meanings.definition: A person or thing that deviates from a norm or standard.
meanings.sent1: The deviators in the group always took a different path.
meanings.sent2: The teacher noticed the deviators in the class who preferred unique solutions.
meanings.sent3: The deviators at the party decided to play a game no one else knew.
meanings.sent4: The deviators in the flock stood out like colorful birds among the rest.
meanings.sent5: The deviators in the forest left a trail of footprints that led in unexpected directions.

meanings.sent1: The deviators were displayed in the museum for all to see.
meanings.sent2: She collected antique deviators as a hobby.
meanings.sent3: The deviators on the shelf seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent4: The deviators on the map marked the locations of hidden treasures.
meanings.sent5: The deviators in the collection added a touch of history to the room.
